alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampshire; Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 11:52AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hampshire, central Franklin and northwestern Hampden Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1151 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Becket, or 9 miles southeast of Pittsfield, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail, along with torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northampton, Greenfield, Deerfield, South Hadley, Montague, Hadley, Sunderland, Hatfield, Williamsburg, Huntington, Conway, Shelburne, Ashfield, Westhampton, Whately, Chester, Chesterfield, Worthington, Goshen, and Cummington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
